page.title: 02 Changing Times.
page.content: On Coronation day, 1953, the houses were decorated with paper flowers all different colours.They were stuck all over the houses and there were ropes from house to house with triangles of different coloured cloth. On the top of the doorways they had crepe paper with a picture of the Queen in the middle and EIIR either side. Inside the windows there were ropes hanging down with red white and blue things at the end.Villagers had home parties, on Sundays they had a midday dinner but for tea they had sandwiches and afterwards they had jelly,ice cream and cakes. Every morning people had porridge for breakfast.At Faber School, where the boys wore shorts,the pupils were taught by nuns who also used the cane.The local railway had steam trains,which could be noisy and dirty, but the track was lifted 20yrs ago.
